intro: Premna tateana, commonly known as the Japanese nettle. It is a flowering plant native to East Asia, particularly Japan, Korea, and China. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its foliage is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical significance lies in its ecological role and ornamental value.
